question: How does a matrix differ from a data frame?

options.text: A matrix may contain numeric values only.
A matrix must not be singular.
A data frame may contain variables that have different modes.

What is the principal difference between an array and a matrix?

options.text: A matrix has two dimensions, while an array can have three or more dimensions.

. How does a vector differ from a list?

options.text: Vectors are used only for numeric data, while list are useful for both numeric and string data.
Vectors and lists are the same thing and can be used interchangeably.
